title: Seated Female Nude, Holding One Knee, with Sketch of a Foot

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of reed pen and black ink on white wove paper, laid down on cream wove paper, laid down on ivory wove paper.

dimensions: Primary support: 23.6 × 29.9 cm (9 5/16 × 11 13/16 in.); Secondary support: 31.8 × 23.5 cm (12 9/16 × 9 5/16 in.); Tertiary support: 38.3 × 31.4 cm (15 1/8 × 12 3/8 in.)
medium_display: Reed pen and black ink on white wove paper, laid down on cream wove paper, laid down on ivory wove paper
inscriptions: Signed and dated recto, lower left, in black ink: "Henri Matisse  août 1909"
publication_history: Raymond Escholier, Henri Matisse (Paris, 1937), p. 37 (ill.). Alfred H. Barr, Jr., Matisse: His Art and His Public (New York, 1951), pp. 137 (ill.), 138, as Woman Nursing Knee; A Foot (Nu assis; pied). Sergio Solmi, “Disegni di Matisse,” Sele Arte 1, no. 2 (Sept.–Oct. 1952), p. 54 (ill.), as Nu assis 1909. Clement Greenberg, Henri Matisse (1869– ), The Pocket Library of Great Art (Harry N. Abrams, 1953), pl. 6, as Studies of Woman Holding Knee, 1909. Raymond Escholier, Matisse, Ce Vivant (Paris, 1956), p. 37 (ill.). James Watrous, The Craft of Old Master Drawings (Madison, Wisc., 1957), (ill.) opp. p. 52. Mario Luzi and Massimo Carrà, L’Opera di Matisse: dalla rivolta ‘fauve’ all’intimismo, 1904–1928, Classici dell’arte, 49 (Milan, 1971), p. 109 (ill.), cat. D5, as Nudo seduto e un piede. A.R. Elsen, Sculpture of Matisse (New York, 1972), p. 139 (ill.). Stephen Longstreet, The Drawings of Henri Matisse (Borden Publishing, 1973), n.pag. (ill.), as Seated Nude Woman, Her Hands Clasped Around Her Knees. Clement Greenberg, Henri Matisse (New York, 1973), n.p. (ill.), pl. 6, as Studies of Woman Holding Knee. A. Izerghina, et al., trans. by R. J. Rosengrant, V. Paperno, Yu. Nemetsky, and I. Vlader, Henri Matisse: Paintings and Sculptures in Soviet Museums (Leningrad, 1978) p. 188 (ill.), as The Foot. Pierre Schneider, Matisse (Flammarion, 1984), p. 132 (ill.), as [no title], 1909. Jack Flam, Matisse: The Man and His Art, 1869–1918 (Cornell University Press, 1986), p. 289, fig. 290, as Seated Model Clasping Her Knees, 1909. Pierre Schneider, Matisse, new ed. (Flammarion, 2002), p. 132 (ill.), as Nu assis, jambe repliée, 1909. “Seated Female Nude, Holding One Knee, with a Sketch of a Foot,” in Matisse Paintings, Works on Paper, Sculpture, and Textiles at the Art Institute of Chicago, ed. Stephanie D’Alessandro (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 2019), cat. 16, https://publications.artic.edu/matisse/reader/works/section/24/24_anchor.
exhibition_history:
London, Grafton Galleries, Manet and the Post-Impressionists, Nov. 8, 1910–Jan. 15, 1911, as Drawing (no 176).

The Art Institute of Chicago, "A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Paintings and Sculpture Lent from American Collections", June 1–November 1, 1933, p. 101, cat. 1033, as Woman Nursing Knee—A Foot.

New York, Museum of Modern Art, Henri Matisse, Nov. 13, 1951–Jan. 13, 1952; Cleveland Museum of Art, Feb. 5–Mar. 16, 1952; Art Institute of Chicago, Apr. 1–May 4, 1952, addendum to catalogue, no cat. no., as Women [sic] Nursing Knee, (1909); San Francisco Museum of Art, May 22–July 6, 1952 (Chicago only).

Los Angeles, University of California, Art Council, "Henri Matisse," 1966, p. 144 (ill.), cat. 153.

Baltimore, Museum of Art, "Matisse as Draftsman," 1971, p. 54 (ill.), cat. 17.

New York, Museum of Modern Art, "The Sculpture of Matisse," 1972, p. 33 (ill.), 55, cat. 81, as Seated Model Clasping Knee; traveled to Minneapolis, Walker Art Center, June 20-August 6,1972; Berkeley, Calif., University Art Museum, University of California, September 18-october 29, 1972.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Imaging the Body," January 30–April 28, 1992.

Chicago, AIC, “Matisse: Radical Invention 1913–1917,” March 20–June 20, 2010, p. 105, cat. 10f, cat. by Stephanie D’Alessandro
provenance_text: Emily Crane Chadbourne (1871-1964), Stone Ridge, NY and Washington, D. C., by Nov. 8, 1910; given to the Art Institute, 1926.
copyright_notice: © 2018 Succession H. Matisse / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York
section_titles: Cat. 16  Seated Female Nude, Holding One Knee, with a Sketch of a Foot, Aug. 1909

input: Seated Female Nude, Holding One Knee, with Sketch of a Foot
